FuncDef:
The efm mode command configures the EFM OAM working mode for an interface.
The undo efm mode command restores the default setting.
By default, the EFM OAM working mode of an interface is active.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the EFM OAM working mode of an interface is active.
-

Indicates that the EFM OAM working mode of an interface is passive.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Ethernet OAM connections can be established in either active or passive mode. The interface in active mode has more functions than the interface in passive mode, When Ethernet users access a service provider (SP) network, the SP network works in active mode. By setting the working mode of EFM OAM, you can configure whether a device can send or receive a specified type of EFM OAM PDU.
Prerequisites
EFM OAM has been globally enabled using the efm enable command in the system view.
Configuration Impact
Only an interface in active mode can initiate peer discovery and remote loopback.
Follow-up Procedure
After running the efm mode command, you must run the efm enable command to enable EFM OAM on the interface.
